jpcap
Class Jpcap

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jpcap.Jpcap
public class Jpcap
extends java.lang.Object

Main class of package jpcap.
Capturing and Sending packets are done through the instance of this class.

Sample tcpdump-like capturing program.

 import jpcap.*;
 
 class Tcpdump implements JpcapHandler
 {
   public void handlePacket(Packet packet){
     System.out.println(packet);
   }
 
   public static void main(String[] args) throws java.io.IOException{
     Jpcap jpcap=new Jpcap(args[0],1000,true,20);
     jpcap.processPacket(-1,new Tcpdump());
   }
 }

Constructor Detail

Jpcap

public Jpcap(java.lang.String device,
             int snaplen,
             boolean promisc,
             int to_ms)
      throws java.io.IOException
Initializes the specified network interface and creates the instance of this class.
Parameters:
device - Name of the interface (eg: hme0,eth0)
snaplen - Maximum number of bytes captured at once
promisc - The specified interface goes promiscuous mode if true
to_ms - Time out of processPacket()
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the speficied interface couldn't be open

Jpcap

public Jpcap(java.lang.String filename)
      throws java.io.IOException
Opens the dump file created by tcpdump and creates the instance of this class.
Parameters:
filename - Name of dump file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the specified file couldn't open
Method Detail

lookupDevice

public static java.lang.String lookupDevice()
Returns the name of the device which can be used for capturing.
Returns:
Name of the found device

getPacket

public Packet getPacket()
Captures one packet.

processPacket

public int processPacket(int count,
                         JpcapHandler handler)
Captures the specified number of packets consecutively.
Parameters:
count - Maximum number of packets processing
-1 means to process packets unlimitedly.
handler - The captures packets are passed to this JpcapHandler object to analyze
Returns:
Number of packet captured

setFilter

public void setFilter(java.lang.String condition,
                      boolean optimize)
Sets up the capturing filter.
Parameters:
condition - String which represents the condition of filtering. (See the document of tcpdump)
optimize - Filter is optimized if true

updateStat

public void updateStat()
Updates received_packets and dropped_packets

openRawSocket

public void openRawSocket()
Initializes the sending socket.
This method must be called before sending packets.

sendPacket

public void sendPacket(IPPacket packet)
Sends a IP packet.

Currently only TCP/UDP/ICMP over IPv4 are supported.
For ICMP, only echo packets can be sent.
Parameters:
packet - IP packet to be sent

public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
Returns the error message which was caused by the error while capturing.

Close the interface or dump file which is currently opened.
